definition: three-stroke form of Kangxi radical 94 犬[quan3]
wolverine (Gulo gulo), also named 貂熊[diao1 xiong2]

sentences.english: Small ferret-like badger of southeast asia.
sentences.chinese: 产于东南亚象雪貂的獾。

sentences.english: 'Where's Mr. Badger?' inquired the Mole, as he warmed the coffee-pot before the fire.
sentences.chinese: “獾先生上哪去了？”鼹鼠问，他正在炉火上温咖啡。

sentences.english: Bustards are now associated with the Badger MK II for invention purposes as the BPC requirement.
sentences.chinese: 大鸨级飞船现作为獾级蓝图II的发明要求。

sentences.english: Badgers have heavy bodies, thick skin, short legs, and short tails.
sentences.chinese: 獾的身体笨重，皮肤很厚，脚短尾短。

sentences.english: Breakfast was almost finished when the Badger entered, looking sleepy.
sentences.chinese: 早餐几乎结束了，獾才睡眼惺松地走了进来。

sentences.english: MK II for invention purposes as the BPC requirement.
sentences.chinese: 大鸨级飞船现作为獾级蓝图II的发明要求。

sentences.english: Countryside characters, Ed and Edwina Hedgehog, Tom Mouse, Sam Rabbit and Badger.
sentences.chinese: 农村字符，教育署及派驻刺猬，汤姆鼠，黄兔，獾。
美洲獾会被卡在溜滑梯吗？

sentences.english: We love the fact that Badger Balms come in an all metal twist top container.
sentences.chinese: 我们爱的事实，獾香膏来在所有的金属扭曲顶端容器。

sentences.english: Shelob's shriek is actually the sound of a Tasmanian devil.
sentences.chinese: 大蜘蛛尸罗的叫声实际上是袋獾的叫声。

sentences.english: The badger and the snake had a ferocious battle in the woods.
sentences.chinese: 獾和蛇在树林里进行了一场恶斗。

sentences.english: The agency kills foxes, badgers and other predators.
sentences.chinese: 他们杀死狐狸，獾和其他食肉动物。

sentences.english: They fired the badger out of the hole.
sentences.chinese: 他们用火把獾从洞中熏出来。

sentences.english: She was as heavy as a badger.
The Badger strode heavily into the room.
sentences.chinese: 獾大步流星地跨进房间。

sentences.english: And now there are badgers here again.

definition: raccoon dog (Nyctereutes procyonoides)/raccoon of North China, Korea and Japan (Japanese: tanuki)/also pr. [hao2]
